sub_title: Market Research | Data Analyst | Supply Chain Management | Data Science | Vietnamese | English
summary:
“Be the change that you wish to see in the world” – Mahatma Gandhi.

      Growing up in the economic reformation period of Vietnam, I have witnessed many major changes to improve the livelihoods of the citizen. However, unsustainable development has paid the way for environmental degradation which is now a current headache of policy makers. 

      During my college years, I had a chance to participate in many organizations which enable youths to utilize their leadership capacity for the greater good of the society such as the Enactus team at Foreign Trade University Hanoi and Sponsor for Educational Opportunities Vietnam. These experience undoubtedly cemented my belief that aggregation of small changes can definitely create a great impact to our society by becoming a part of the social innovative trend, using positive power of technology and entrepreneurship to tackle the problem.

      Currently, I am looking for a chance to take a deep dive in renewable technology and supply chain management as the next step of my career and I will show no hesitant to start from the bottom even if my background is general business and economics. 
Feel free to reach out should you have any question and thank you for spending time skimming my CV below!

1. My Lifescore: 82/100

I am experiencing success in multiple areas of life
I am proficient at setting clear goals ( that's what helped you get where you are today)
I am spending a majority of your time focused on getting ahead at work, but may have neglected fun and rejuvenating pastimes

education.degree_name: Exchange Scholar of Young Southeast Asian Leader Initiatives Academic Fellow Spring 2018

awards.title: Young Southeast Asian Leadership Initiatives Academic Fellows in Natural Resources Management and Environmental Issues
awards.description:
The YSEALI Academic Fellows Program, which was founded by President Barack Obama, brings 21 young leaders between the ages of 18 and 25 to the United States for a five-week institute. The program provides an academic residency, leadership development, an educational study tour, local community service activities, and opportunities to engage with American peers. The program will conclude in Washington, D.C., to allow for engagement with policymakers, governmental representatives, businesses, and think tanks.
-	1 of 3 Vietnamese young leaders chosen by The US Embassy in Vietnam to attend the fellowship
awards.issuer: Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs - United States Department of State

awards.title: First prize
awards.description: Won the 1st prize with $1000 in cash at The U.S Ambassador Entrepreneurship Challenge in 2017 (150 teams nationwide).

awards.title: Delegate at The American Institue in Taiwan Youth Camp
awards.description: In collaboration with the U.S. Embassies in Singapore, Vietnam and, Indonesia and in partnership with National ChengChi University, the American Institute in Taiwan is launching its fourth annual Youth Camp.  This year’s camp will bring together approximately 50 young Asian leaders, and will focus on regional development and cooperation, cultural exchange, and social innovation.  Camp activities include interactive panels led by experts from U.S. government-sponsored exchange programs, cultural exploration, and leadership development sessions.
awards.issuer: The Director of The American Institute in Taiwan

awards.title: Delegation of Myanmar in Model East Asia Summit
awards.description:
Model East Asia Summit is an extracurricular activity that allows students to discuss relevant international issues that government leaders face on a day-to-day basis.

The events was held by The American Center in Hanoi for high school or university student who is interested in debating international issues from different view points and positions should consider participating in Model East Asia Summit.
awards.issuer: The United State Embassy in Hanoi

profile_positions.description:
- Deployed applications for 14 international airlines on Airbus Skywise.
- Wrote a deployment guideline documentation for 1 app.
- Developed, maintained, and shared data pipelines between Airbus and airlines.
- Coordinated between different data teams, data platforms, and vendors to resolve weekly ad-hoc data issues from airlines.
profile_positions.title: Associate Data Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Main responsibilities include developing machine learning prediction models for the optimization of Operation & Maintenance scheduling of offshore wind farms in the Netherlands
-      Collect and sanitize data on wind speed, wave height, and wind energy from various sources (in Excel and R)
-      Develop 1 missing values imputation model to sanitize the data using random forest (in R)
-      Develop 2 short-term prediction models for the wave height, wind speed & wind energy based on Nonlinear Autoregressive Moving Average Neural Network (in R)
-      Develop 1 long-term prediction model for wind speed based on Fourier Autoregressive Moving Average (in R)
-      Analyze and decompose the wind speed, wind energy, and wave height time series data based on Seasonal Trend decomposition with Loess (STL)
-      Develop 1 desk research on available tokenization platforms and their sizes.
profile_positions.title: Data Science Intern

profile_positions.description:

- Conducted 2 internal control audits, deliver 1 Productivity plan for FY2019 2020
- Coordinated saving 20 projects across The SEA region to meet saving targets in 4 months 5 projects
were completed and achieved the desired target

volunteer_experiences.description:
Main responsibilities include fundraising and managing the operation of the organization.
- Won and raised USD 1000 from Young Southeast Asian Leadership Initiatives Microgrant 2018 from The U.S. Embassy in Hanoi and US 10000 US Alumni Grant.
- Organized 4 workshops in 17 UN SDGs, marketing, sale, 3D printing, creative thinking for 20 high school students.
- Received 75 applications, 6 students (35%) involved want to continue or establish a business project in their school.
- 90% of participants have a clear answer whether they like business or not after the
camp.
- 100% of participants indicate their preferred majors in the future.
- Nearly 100,000 people through online Channels in just 1 month (14/11/2018 to 16/12/2018).
- More than 600 reach/post on Facebook with more than 200 reactions.

volunteer_experiences.role: Director Of External Relations/ Alumnus Advisor

company.name: Enactus Foreign Trade University Hanoi Campus

volunteer_experiences.description:
• Main responsibility includes leading a group of 7 students to raise fund by seeking and maintaining sponsorship from companies and invited business leaders to become our business advisor for Enactus’s projects.
• 35 million VND was raised (exceeded 200% target).
• 2 business advisors invited: Ms. Phan Hoang Hoa – CEO – Apollo Education & Training Corporation; Mr. Dan Rathbun - Director of USAID/DAI
• 1 long – term sponsor: Mr. Nguyen Van Dung – Managing director - Havina Language Academy.
• Created and managed a system of 300 sponsors, partners, and business advisors, including contact details, profiles, and cooperative history.
• Created Standard Operation Procedure (SOP) for internal training which reduced 30% of the training period.
• 1 “IELTS Demand of Hanoi Foreign Trade University students Survey” with the sample of 500 students.
• 1 public relation consultation project in Foreign Trade University for Havina Language Academy including 1 survey of 500 students and 1 trial class for it.10/25 students applied to their course after the project.
• 3 partnership and memorandum signed and implemented.

volunteer_experiences.role: Vice Manager of Community Service Department/ Fellow
volunteer_experiences.description:
Main responsibility included organizing community projects for fellows to attend, searching and connecting qualified mentors, guest speakers for fellow teams so that they can support SEO – Vietnam’s Community Service partners to solve their problems; contacting and establishing partnerships with new NPO to develop the programs.
- Engaged Tue Vien Center for Autism and Mental Disabilities Children as a new partnership.
- 2 field visits organized for fellows to be inspired by partners’ activities.
- 1 voluntary trip organized for fellows to volunteer at partner’s site.
- 4 mentors from Topica, Philip Morris, The Economist, Lazada invited (Manager level)
- 4 workshops organized for 30 fellows

company.name: Enactus Foreign Trade University Hanoi Campus

volunteer_experiences.description:
Main responsibilities include envisioning, developing and consulting the management board; retaining alumni as mentors for new members.
- Developed the scope of FBA Innovation from regional to the national competition called Vietnam Social Innovation Challenge since 2017.
- Coordinated 2 organizing teams in Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh campus
- Attracted 220 projects (100% higher application rate than previous years), 5000 audiences attracted nationwide.
- 1 cooperation project coordinated with Enactus London School of Economics and Political Science to deliver 1 career orientation package in online selling with 5 workshops to 5 disadvantaged children at Blue Dragon Children Foundation. 1 children actually did sell cosmetic online after the workshop

- Main responsibility included searching and connecting qualified mentors to fellow teams so that they can support SEO – Vietnam’s Community service partners to solve their problems.
- Connected 5 Non - Profit Organizations to SEO - Vietnam for cooperation and support.
- 5 mentors from EY, McKinsey&Co, BCG&Co, Vingroup invited.
- After the program, fellow teams' proposals were accepted by NPO partners and they agreed to establish cooperation with the next programs.

1516 Energy is a social enterprise dedicating to raise the quality of life of mountainous and remote communities by installing compact, handmade wind turbines system and electricity generator (120W) to provide affordable renewable energy and lighting. My main responsibilities include managing relations with 2 investors, fundraising, recruiting experts to serve as advisors of the board.
- Won the 1st prize with $1000 in cash at The U.S Ambassador Entrepreneurship Challenge in 2017 (150 teams nationwide).
- Expanded project scope from 1 to 3 provinces in Vietnam
- Conducted need & want survey for 10 households, recruited 2 advisors for the technical development.
- Installed 28 more wind turbines

•	Main responsibility included planning lessons, grading, translating and co-teaching baseball, biology and life skills to disadvantaged secondary pupils with US students.
- 144 volunteering hours in 3 weeks
- 12 classes and 1 lesson planning session per day
- 60 kids taught

Main responsibility included training upcoming coaches to adapt and prepare for the camp. 
- 3 training workshops for 6 coaches. 
- Improved 25% of coach’s adaptation by role-play training. 
- 40 volunteering hours

Mekong Business Challenge is the leading annual competition for young entrepreneurials in Greater Mekong Subregion plus Bhutan. I coordinated with organize team to usher team to the stage.
- Assisting and guiding 5 foreign teams in Hanoi Foreign Trade University Campus.

Researching and conducting survey about dog's meat consumption in Hanoi.
Organizing Dog's Day Out Event.
Assist foreign vet to examine pet's health.
